titlestmt.titleproper: Mary Bartlett Smith Papers, Class of 1897, 1875 - 1953
titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Madison White, Class of 2016.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Elizabeth Carron. 2014-12-02

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Contains letters, recipes, certificates, programs, articles, correspondence, photographs, notebooks, and various published works, including poetry and a memoir, which document the life of Mary Bartlett Smith, Class of 1897.

bioghist.p: Born in 1875, Mary Bartlett Smith lived most of her childhood in various Massachusetts' small towns with her parents Mary and Calvin and a brother, Teddy. At Smith, she became secretary of the Current Events Club. She earned her B.A. in Classics in 1897. After graduating, she continued her education at various institutions including: Smithsonian Institute, Framingham Normal, Simmons College, Boston University, Columbia University, The Business Training Corp. of New York City, and the Chicago Bureau of Filing and Indexing. Smith taught in various private schools across New York and Massachusetts as she was completing her education, but spent most of her career as a statistician for various industries. After the death of her sister-in-law in 1936, she moved to Bartlesville, Oklahoma to help her brother raise his two sons. She died there on February 12, 1953.

scopecontent.p: The Collection contains some information about Mary Bartlett Smith's time at Smith such as photographs and some poetry published in the Smith College Weekly. However, most of the information pertains to her life as an alumna, including a large selection of her published and unpublished writings. These include a body of poetry, short stories, articles, and a memoir titled Cataracts. Mary Bartlett Smith also collected articles written by her classmate, Alice Weld Tallant '97 and which are included in the collection.

arrangement.p: The collection is arranged according to genre and is arranged into eight (8) folders.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Mary Bartlett Smith Papers, Box #1543, Smith College Archives

acqinfo.p: The Mary Bartlett Smith papers were donated to the College Archives.

processinfo.p: Processed by Madison White, Class of 2016, Elizabeth Carron, Archivist
